page.title: 10Eggar's Grammar School
page.content: {Eggar's Grammar School}was founded by {John Eggar}in 1642. He was appalled by the standard of education in the area, so he opened the school mainly for his son's benefit. There is a tale about the old Eggar's. One day the headmaster lost his patience with a boy. As punishment he was locked in a small room in the roof of old Eggar's. Unfortunately the headmaster forgot all about him and the boy starved to death. Today the old Eggar's building is still occasionally used by the Alton Sixth Form College or for Evening Classes. Modern Eggar's is a Comprehensive school of about 900 pupils, in a new purpose-built building situated quite close to the old school.
